sentence.text: CGD is a genetically heterogeneous disease with an X-linked recessive (XR-CGD) form caused by mutations in the CYBB gene encoding the gp91(phox) protein, and an autosomal recessive (AR-CGD) form caused by mutations in the cytochrome complex assembly, protein targeting to membrane, NCF2, or antigen processing and presentation of exogenous peptide antigen via MHC class I, TAP-dependent genes encoding p22(phox) , p47(phox) , p67(phox) , and p40(phox) , respectively.

entity.text: antigen processing and presentation of exogenous peptide antigen via MHC class I, TAP-dependent
